column2: ENGLISH
Short
This character is of short stature
Torturer
This character likes to spend the nights in the dungeon, inventing new ways of torturing unfortunate victims.
This character leads the life of a scholar, poring over books and corresponding with the finest minds of world.
The character is infamously greedy, always wanting more and more.
This character is famously charitable always willing to help those in need.
This character is shockingly lazy, neglecting his duties and responsibilities.
This character is dutiful and diligent always bustling around and managing to keep himself busy.
This character is envious, having insatiable desire of others' possessions.
This character is kind and full of empathy always thinking more about others then himself.
This character certainly has a hot temper and always rushes into action without thinking.
This character is patient, willing to invest time and care in everything he does.
This character is lustful possessing intense desire for pleasure.
This character is perfect example of chastity, placing his virtue before the carnal desires.
This character is proud always boasting about his deeds no matter how insignificant.
This character is modest, never boasting, always doing everything with humbleness.
This character enjoys the small pleasures of life - good food, good drinks and maybe more food.
This character believes in the virtue of moderation and always avoiding excess.
This child is proud and vain, convinced of their own superiority. Can develop into: §YProud§!, §YArbitrary§!, §YCruel§! or §YRacist§!.
This child is kind and is quick to show love and affection. Can develop into: §YKind§!, §YContent§!, §YTrusting§! or §YTolerant§!.
This child loves to engage in fun and games, almost always turning any activity into an excuse to play. Can develop into: §YGregarious§!, §YDeceitful§!, §YGambler§! or (rarely) §YLunatic§!.
This child is unusually scrupulous and responsible, taking delight in completing any chores and tasks to perfection. Can develop into: §YDiligent§!, §YTemperate§! or §YReasonable§!.
Catriona
of the dreaded Catriona
Has the Catriona!
This character has the dreaded Catriona.
The Bane has brought the Catriona to this county.
Invite Priest to Court
Scour the land for a priest to join my court and advise me on religious matters.
Invite Steward to Court
Invite a promising steward to court, to aid with matters of administration.
Royal Huntsman

As [Root.GetSheHe] is your prisoner, you may give the order to permanently blind [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and then setting [Root.GetHerHim] free. A severe punishment as a blind [Root.GetManWoman] is threat to no one.
With no real fleet of my own in times of war I must rely on merchant shipping that can be conscripted - for a tidy sum of gold, of course...
Tales of your misdeeds are told from Kovir to Zangwebar.
Kings and emperors fought a constant battle with their vassals over privileges, rights and obligations. The nobility, naturally, tended to favour a weak state...
Let all archers of the realm be invited

This system of administration has a hierarchy of magistrates and functionaries running daily business in the name of the emperor. It allows for a power structure that hands less power to permanently landed vassals.

Priests are not obliged to pay any taxes - or provide levies - to their secular liege. They will pay the religious head or their secular liege depending on who they like best.

Open
Open

This is the succession type in the great naval Merchant Republics. The next Grand Mayor is determined from among the heads of the five grand Patrician families depending on Age, Prestige, and invested Campaign Funds.

On succession, Weak Claims are given to children who are not second or third in the line of succession. Weak Claims can only be pressed against:
§Y* Female Rulers if the claimant is male
* Regencies
* Titles already being contested in a Claim or Succession War
* Titles the claimant is second or third in line to inherit
* Empires with No or Weak Imperial Authority§!
The world is in constant strife, but only the most important of conflicts have been recorded in history. Choose one of them...
Pacifist
It's hard being a good [Root.Religion.GetName] these days, but my friend truly shocked me when I realized we did not share the same religion. My dear friend is a heretic!
I shall try to convert my friend to the one true faith!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] tries to convert [This.GetTitledFirstName] to a God-fearing [Root.Religion.GetName]
Who cares about religion anyway? I don't!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] accepts that [This.GetTitledFirstName] is a [This.Religion.GetName]
I can't be friends with a heretic!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is no longer friends with [This.GetTitledFirstName]

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is a devout [From.Religion.GetName], so when I told [From.GetHerHim] that I believed in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] rather than [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] I knew what [From.GetSheHe] was going to say. After a long, heated discussion about religion, considered disadvantages and advantages of our respective religions I decided to...
...keep my religion but lose my friend
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] cannot be friends with someone who does not respect [Root.GetHerHis] religion
...keep my friend and convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] religion
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] converts to [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s religion
...keep both my religion and my friend

I feared what [From.GetTitledFirstName] would say when I told [From.GetHerHim] that I did not believe in [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], that I am a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] and I would not give up my religion for anyone. [From.GetTitledFirstName] was more understanding than I would've thought [From.GetHerHim] to be, and after asking some questions [From.GetSheHe] seemed to accept me and my religion.
A friend like you is hard to find, [From.GetTitledFirstName]

It went exactly as I had feared - [From.GetTitledFirstName] couldn't accept me being a [Root.Religion.GetName] and condemned me and my religion. I tried to reason with [From.GetTitledFirstName] and told [From.GetHerHim] about all the similarities with [From.GetHerHis] religion and [From.Religion.GetName] but I was talking to deaf ears.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] decided [From.GetSheHe] couldn't be friends with a heretic

I tried talking to [From.GetTitledFirstName], discuss, argue, everything! Nothing I said, nothing I did could convince [From.GetTitledFirstName] to abandon [From.GetHerHis] heretical ways and embrace the one true faith, the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion. Our disagreement about religion were never solved and [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me I was no longer [From.GetHerHis] friend...
I agree, we can no longer be friends

The difference between a [Root.Religion.GetName] and a [From.Religion.GetName] is that...'\nI reasoned with [From.GetTitledFirstName] about [From.GetHerHis] religion and tried to explain why being a [From.Religion.GetName] in this day and age was a bad idea.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] decided to convert and become a [Root.Religion.GetName]
[From.GetTitledFirstName] did not heed my warning

Honoured [Root.GetTitle],

I am not surprised that you would stoop so low, but your attempt to blackmail me is in vain. I have nothing to hide.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Tell us more about this mythical realm of Haak.
I will never be better than the current Court Mage.
By the [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], let me through!
Your charity work in [Root.Location.GetName] goes well. The [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] would approve of your Master's actions. Perhaps you should send word.
We can still do much good.
Word has reached you that [From.GetTitledName], has given in to weakness and helped [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the alms [From.GetSheHe] was meant to distribute amongst the poor.
[From.GetTitledName], was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and has been seriously wounded while giving alms to the poor in your name. Charity can be dangerous work.
[From.GetTitledName], who was performing charity work in your name, made the ultimate sacrifice when he was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and trampled to death.
[FromFrom.GetTitledName], reports that [From.GetTitledName] has been humbled by your endless generosity to the poor in [From.Location.GetName]. The peasants are singing your name!
I have been reading [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], and it claims that death is not something a true follower [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] should be afraid of.
Forgive me [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], for I have sinned.

You are enjoying a late supper at the Great Palace in Nilfgaard, sampling some new wines brought in from the provinces, when the sound of a distant explosion is heard. Windows shatter and the chandelier above begins to sway as the shockwave hits a second later. Dust trickles down from the roof, and to your dismay some of it lands in your wine.\n\nYou hurry to a balcony overlooking the city and see an intense fire burning at one of the warehouses by the docks. The nearby water in the Geg Alba is also ablaze, and the fire has already spread to several ships in the busy inlet. While their crews are in the process of abandoning them, the harbor area is rocked by a flurry of smaller explosions from the burning warehouse.
It is time to pass my legacy to my child! The torture methods I have refined, the secrets only I and other masters of he art know and the use of instruments of torture.

My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] asked me if I wanted to watch a prisoner being tortured. [From.GetSheHeCap] wants me to become a master torturer, just as [From.GetSheHe] [From.GetHerselfHimself].
I could try fishing, it will turn the boredom in relaxation.
I should try fishing instead.

You have come into possession of a copy of the "Good Book of Prophet Lebioda's Wisdom", a book detailing the prophet's musings on philosophy and morality. Studying this historical work could provide insights that improve your learning.

At last, you have finished your studies of the Good Book of Prophet Lebioda's Wisdom. It took many nights of reading with only the light of a candle to keep you company, but you do not regret a second of it. Your learning has improved.

An old weather-bitten diplomat who has served in most of the courts in the Northern Kingdoms ("the ones that mattered at least") agreed to take you under his wing for a few days. He has taught you many valuable tricks in how to deal with vassals and other rulers.
A sword made of metal that fell from the sky. Some say it is a gift from [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Preferatus
The Preferatus is the Priest Elector expected to succeed the current Hierarch.
The College of Electors
The College of Electors

Money in the Campaign Fund will increase your influence with the Hierarch and make your candidate more likely to be elected the next $RULER_TITLE$. You can freely adjust the amount until the next $RULER_TITLE$ is elected, when the Fund will be used up in the election campaign.

Your prisoner has been blinded and released. The fool should have knows better than to look at you with scornful eyes.
$NEWHOLDER$ was given a seat in the College of Electors.
$NEWHOLDER$ was given a seat in the College of Electors.
Your vassal $NEWHOLDER$ was given a seat in the College of Electors.
Your vassal $NEWHOLDER$ was given a seat in the College of Electors.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House var Emreis. Members of this dynasty unified the kingdoms in the south and founded the Nilfgaardian empire only 132 years ago. Now Nilfgaard rules all the kingdoms up to the Jaruga.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat the Radowidowie dynasty. The line began with Sambuk, one of the first human rulers of the continent. His descendants founded the kingdoms of Redania and Temeria.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat the Dezmoden dynasty. For generations members of this dynasty rule over Temeria.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat the Cerbinsoun dynasty. For generations members of this dynasty rule over Cintra, a cadet branch over Lyria
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat the Edinorog dynasty. For generations members of this dynasty rule over Kaedwen.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Thyssen descended from Godamba Thaess'en. His descendants ruled over Kovir after the Trojdeninds died out.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Feleaorn, one of the ruling Elven dynasty before the humans arrived
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House of Skellige, rulers of the Skellige Islands.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House of Ethain, rulers of Cidaris
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Baldwining, rulers of Aedirn.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Trojden, first rulers of Kovir. Descending from the younger brother of Radowid of Redania the Trojdenids forged the cold northern provinces of Kovir into a powerful kingdom. The Thyssenids are their descendants via the female line.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Voorhis, a powerful Nilfgaardian dynasty that's closely related to the var Emreis. Morvran Voorhis became Nilfgaardian Emperor after Emhyr died.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Etcheverry, lowly counts spread out over Temeria.
With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Pangratz. They are only known for being the dynasty of the famous bard Dandelion á la Alfred Julian Pankratz viscount de Lettehove.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Loredo. The only thing that history will remember from this house is that they slaughtered half they allowed a pogrom to happen and then sold out to Kaedwen, the enemy.
Even if you have multiple swords, in a duel you can use only one or with Ambidextrous trait - two swords.
Owning a legendary sword or armor increases your chance of victory in duels.
Welcome to the Witcher Kings !
Different races have different lifespans, elves normally live more that 300 years, but dwarves no more than 150 years.
If you have problems with monsters, hire a witcher, but don't expect him to stay long, as witchers go where there is work for them.
Humans can change Crown Laws once per lifetime, but those with a longer lifespan can change them once every 20 years.
The longest living race isn't elves or dwarves, but sorcerers, as they can live for centuries.
Elves reach maturity and can have children at the age of 50.
The fertility of elves gets reduced after each birth.
Artifacts and other items of value are not passed along the titles but within the dynasty instead.
The Yaruga and Pontar rivers are the most strategic ones of the Continent.
You can toggle pre-rendered character portraits in the game rules.
If you take a ward, you also have to pay for his education.
Weak claims can be pressed freely against empires with low Imperial Authority.
Empires with very low Imperial Authority can be destroyed if there is no suitable heir for current succession law.
With non-tolerant law Scoia'tael supporters may appear, but you can nominate a commander of special forces to fight them.
A child learns swordsmanship from his guardian, and is limited by his skills.
Children become adolescent at 11, and adult at 15.
In Elder Speech, Ard- prefix means higher/greater, while An- means lower/lesser.
In Elder Speech, Kaer means Keep or Castle.
Elven sorcerers need two fertility traits if they hope to become fertile.
Witcher Kings is based primarily on the books, secondarily on the games.
Dryads are mono-gendered and produce offspring by seducing humans and elves.
Sorcerers can hold magical tower holdings, which have a special building tree that improves their sorcerer abilities.
Every child has a small chance to have magic talent, but it is greatly increased if any of his parents are sorcerers.
The Wilderness holds empty magic towers and inhabited counties that have become ruins.
Druids make very good court physicians.

column2: [GetLucifersOwnSocietyName]
Cult of Coram Agh Tera
[melitele.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap]'s Own
[GetLucifersOwnSocietyDesc]

Those who serve the Great Weaver hide in our midst, dedicating their depravities and perfidies to their Lord the Lionheaded Spider. Every transgression is a hymn, every murder a roar of defiance against the word of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The Great Weaver rewards such dark sacraments handsomely – witches are said to be gifted with unnatural lifespans and all manner of demonic powers.

Recruit for the Occult
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! lusts for the power of the occult. If so, you may offer [Root.GetHerHim] the embrace of the True Lord.
column3: Tenter de savoir si [Root.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] convoite les puissances occultes. Si c'est le cas, vous pourriez lui proposer l'étreinte du vrai Seigneur.

column6: Averigua si §Y[Root.GetTitleFirstName]§! codicia el poder de las fuerzas ocultas. En caso afirmativo, puedes invitarlo/la a acogerse a la verdadera divinidad.

Blessing of Lilit
This woman has been blessed with the sensuality and infernal allure of Lilit, the demon prophesised to bring ruin to the world.
Blessing of Baalberith
Baalberith, the demon prince of murder and chief secretary of Hell, has blessed this character with overflowing coffers.
Blessing of Draug
Draug, the arch-wraith, has blessed this character with martial prowess.
Blessing of The Hym
The shadow specter has blessed this character with secret knowledge.
Blessing of Gaunter O'Dimm
The Master Mirror has blessed this character with charm and a glib tongue.
Blessing of The Caretaker
The Caretaker has blessed this character with his diligence in its labors.
Blessing of The Black Cat and Dog
The Black Cat and Dog have blessed this character with a devious mind.
[GetHelSocietyName]
Cult of Svalblod
The Fellowship of [freya.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap]
[GetHelSocietyDesc]

The Cult of Svalblod is a secret society devoted to the veneration of Svalblod, an idol who personifies the frenzy and remorseless cruelty of battle. Members believe in the power of destruction and will attempt to use dark magic to sate their greed and thirst for death. At Ragh nar Roog they hope to join the forces of chaos in the fight against the other gods.

The Lovers of [yer.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap]
[GetPlaguebringersSocietyDesc]
The Cult of Niya worships the evil goddess known as Lilit in the west. Members prepare for her return - announced by the Black Sun - which will bring ruin to the world and exterminate all life.
the Alchemist Guild
The Alchemist Guild

Alchemists believe that there are deeply hidden secrets about this world that only the worthy can uncover. As a member you will seek the truth in the stars and planets, through diligent experimentation, and by careful interpretation of ancient texts and symbols.

Every respectable scholar of the scientific arts should take on an apprentice. Alchemical experiments are complex operations which requires extra hands, and what [Root.GetTitle] has enough time to search dusty libraries, shady markets and faraway forests for rare ingredients?
Alchemists may chose an apprentice. In exchange for tutoring, the apprentice will take care of one's laboratory and assist during experiments.
Enables the decision to write a theorem paper and have it be reviewed by fellow members of the guild. If it is accepted, you gain §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§!.\n
Find an Alchemical Text

Your colleague [FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] has found a letter detailing the possible locations of some great old works of Alchemy. A deal has been struck – [FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] shall share the contents of the letter with you, and you shall fund the expedition.
If §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! sets out on one of the expeditions suggested by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! and finds an old alchemical text, the mission is completed.

If I ever find out who broke into my laboratory, I will kill that vile crook! Not only has the thief laid its dirty hands on my precious metals, but my ingredient cabinet has been ransacked also. The culprit must be another follower of the Alchemical arts!
To perform alchemical experiments a member of the Alchemist guild has a demand for rare ingredients with specific attributes.
You steal an alchemical ingredient. It will be added to your treasury.\n
You steal a great alchemical text. It will be added to your treasury.\n
Enables the decision to write a theorem paper and have it be reviewed by fellow members of the guild. If it is accepted, you gain §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§!.\n

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on theurgic rituals! It explores potentially new and rewarding ways of summoning divine beings, which might provide a new approach to Theurgy. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on ascension! It explores the concept of ascension, and new ways by which this state might be achieved, which in turn might provide a new approach to Theurgy. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the Mind of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]! It explores the Divine Truth that permeates this world, and might provide a new insight into Theurgy. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on hieroglyphic translation! It explores the hidden meaning in these ancient texts, which might in turn provide a new insight into Theurgy. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on distillation! It explores new methods of the process, which might enable the creation of a variety of exciting new alchemical elixirs. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on fermentation! It explores new approaches to the process, which might enable the creation of a variety of exciting new alchemical elixirs. Now all that is left is to submit it to my  peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the mysterious Elixir of Life! It explores the concept, both as a source for life eternal as well as a cure for all diseases, and it delves into potential methods of creating it. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the Philosopher's Stone! It explores the object, and its powers of transmuting cheap metal into gold, as well as how to create it. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the planets! It explores astrology, in particular the movement of the planets, and what this could be interpreted as. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the stars! It explores astrology, in particular the constellations, and what truths they contain. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the Moon! It explores astrology, and in particular the movement and importance of this heavenly body. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.

It is finished! I have produced [Root.GetTheoryPaperQuality] paper on the Sun! It explores astrology, and in particular the movement and importance of this heavenly body. Now all that is left is to submit it to my peers, for review.
Unworthy Alchemist
This character was unable to understand the cryptic advice given by a summoned divine being, and is therefore deemed to be an unworthy Alchemist.

My [From.GetSisterBrother] in the Alchemist Guild, [From.GetFirstName], has stepped forth with an idea for a ritual that might invoke the presence of a Divine Being. The prospect of petitioning the Divine itself for knowledge is tantalizing, and the idea was therefore received with excitement in the Guild. The ritual will take place in a few weeks' time.
